flawed_nl_solution:
The first night he read 20% of his 500-page book so he read 0.2*500 = <<20*0.01*500=100>>100 pages
The book is 500 pages and he read 100 so that leaves 500-100 = <<500-100=400>>400 pages
The second night he reads 20% of the 500 pages so he read 0.2*500 = <<20*0.01*500=100>>100 pages
The book is now 400 pages and he read 100 so that leaves 400-100 = <<400-100=3000>>3000 pages
The third night he read 30% of the book so he read 0.3*500 = <<30*0.01*500=150>>150 pages
The book is now 3000 pages and he read 150 pages so he has 3000-150 =<<3000-150=2850>>2850 pages left to read
#### 2850

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 300, not 3000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
